title: Variables in Programming
summary: A variable is a container that stores a value. Its value can change during program execution. Variables have a name, a type, and a stored value.
sample_question: What is a variable, and why do we use it in programming?
teaching_prompt: Explain what variables are and give one real-life analogy.

title: Loops
summary: Loops let us repeat a block of code without writing it multiple times. Common loops include for-loops and while-loops.
sample_question: Can you explain the difference between a for-loop and a while-loop?
teaching_prompt: Teach the concept of loops and explain when you would use them.

title: Functions
summary: A function is a reusable block of code that performs a specific task. Functions help make programs modular and easy to maintain.
sample_question: Why do we use functions in programming?
teaching_prompt: Explain what a function is and give an example.

title: Arrays & Lists
summary: Arrays (or lists) store multiple values in a single variable. Values are stored at specific positions called indexes.
sample_question: What is an array, and how is it different from a regular variable?
teaching_prompt: Teach the concept of arrays and describe how indexing works.

title: Object-Oriented Programming
summary: OOP is a way of structuring code into objects that contain data (attributes) and behavior (methods). Key concepts include classes, objects, inheritance, and encapsulation.
sample_question: What is a class, and how is it related to an object?
teaching_prompt: Explain OOP in simple words and mention two core principles.

title: Data Structures
summary: Data structures organize data so it can be used efficiently. Examples include arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs.
sample_question: What is a data structure, and why is it important?
teaching_prompt: Explain what data structures are and give one example with usage.
